channel.title: Mouse logging
channel.description:
This information has been available to some of us for quite a while now, but I don't think that more than nonspecific warnings have ever made it to most people. Do you know EXACTLY which of your mouse movements Jagex logs, when they're recorded, how they're transmitted? As pplsuqbawlz mentioned, it's actually a separate Runnable class that interacts with a small bit of synchronized code in the client to own our feeble attempts at humanlike mouse movements. Specifically, [url=http://www.upit.be/download.php?id=193]this code.[/url]
Other people feel free to elaborate, I have a digicrack addict demanding his computer back.

item.title: Mouse logging
item.dc:creator: @_1one_eleven1 !!1one!eleven1!
item.description:
@_1one_eleven1 wrote:

[quote=“Krichevskoy, post:15, topic:1599”][quote author=Pwnd link=topic=1628.msg17388#msg17388 date=1145812603]
That’s because they’re stupid as hell.
[/quote]

They’re smarter than us, or at least I assume Andrew is. I know I couldn’t write a graphics engine in C++, much less efficiently port it to Java and build a highly successful company around what amounts to a poor man’s EverQuest

Anyway, the best concept I can think of is to create some curve-modelling logic customized to yourself. I mean, you surely use your computer enough to generate statistically valid probabilities for what sort of motion your mouse would take. I say that without really knowing how much data you would require for a convincing performance…

However, directly manipulating the log is not a good idea, and if you apply this “pre-recording” idea to ACTUAL mouse movements, then you get a remake of Nick Sherlock’s program.[/quote]

Wasnt nicks a recording, but there was no smooth mouse, no waits, pretty much crack shots to x pos.

Read full topic

item.title: Mouse logging
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

Pwnd:

That’s because they’re stupid as hell.

They’re smarter than us, or at least I assume Andrew is. I know I couldn’t write a graphics engine in C++, much less efficiently port it to Java and build a highly successful company around what amounts to a poor man’s EverQuest

Anyway, the best concept I can think of is to create some curve-modelling logic customized to yourself. I mean, you surely use your computer enough to generate statistically valid probabilities for what sort of motion your mouse would take. I say that without really knowing how much data you would require for a convincing performance…

However, directly manipulating the log is not a good idea, and if you apply this “pre-recording” idea to ACTUAL mouse movements, then you get a remake of Nick Sherlock’s program.

Read full topic

That’s because they’re stupid as hell.

item.title: Mouse logging
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

jag024:

This is a pretty good idea I believe, we should all record different human mouse strokes, thought not uyse the same one. Mopar is this possible?

why not? we could all record our own

but what im saying is we could probably all use the same mouse movements atm, because my guess is jagex doesnt compare movements bewtween players

Read full topic

item.title: Mouse logging
item.dc:creator: @jag024 jag024
item.description:
@jag024 wrote:

This is a pretty good idea I believe, we should all record different human mouse strokes, thought not uyse the same one. Mopar is this possible?

item.title: Mouse logging
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

I think the best way to dodge detection is to spend some time actually playing RuneScape, log yourself, and look for little habits, odd patterns, things that are definitively YOUR mouse use. Then model your movement patterns after that. If you think about it, no real person will ever use totally random mouse movements.

Read full topic

item.title: Mouse logging
item.dc:creator: @masonw masonw
item.description:
@masonw wrote:

Maybe we can record it and have certain parts of it changed slightly so Jagex doesn’t catch on to it. If we used the same thing over and over, we would all be banned.

Read full topic

item.title: Mouse logging
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

So, everyone that is botting, ect. will use this recorded mouse movement? I think Jagex would catch on pretty quickly.

Read full topic

item.title: Mouse logging
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Pwnd:

You can’t completely imitate human mouse movements. It has far to many variables, I would think.

you didnt read what I said, I said we should record an actual human playing runescape for an hour or two

Read full topic

item.title: Mouse logging
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

You can’t completely imitate human mouse movements. It has far to many variables, I would think.

Read full topic

item.title: Mouse logging
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Krichevskoy, post:5, topic:1599”]No, he [quote author=Pwnd link=topic=1628.msg15189#msg15189 date=1145505031]

wouldnts the co-ords have to match up with what your actually clicking?

That’s where the false data comes in. You can imitate a mousemovement to where it clicks.
Mopar, Bebe has thought of this a while ago, but she has no idea how, I’d assume ;p
[/quote]

No, I think he means that your world interaction not matching up with the separate log would be a dead giveaway that you were

  1. using a modified client
  2. trying to hide something and need to be banned quickly[/quote]

BUT (big but ;)) we dont know that jagex looks at mousemovements versus actions performed, they could just run the mousemovements through some algorithims to determine if they look human or not, we have no way of knowing unless we test and see how fast we get banned or get banned at all

Read full topic

wouldnts the co-ords have to match up with what your actually clicking?
[/quote]
That’s where the false data comes in. You can imitate a mousemovement to where it clicks.
Mopar, Bebe has thought of this a while ago, but she has no idea how, I’d assume ;p[/quote]

  2. trying to hide something and need to be banned quickly

item.title: Mouse logging
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I was thinking of this the other day, until we make a bot that only sends mousevents and keyevents why not make a dirty hack to make bots like aryan less detectable? Why not fill the mousemovement array that gets sent to jagex with false data? perhaps data that we record by actually manually playing runescape for an hour or two?

Read full topic

This information has been available to some of us for quite a while now, but I don’t think that more than nonspecific warnings have ever made it to most people. Do you know EXACTLY which of your mouse movements Jagex logs, when they’re recorded, how they’re transmitted? As pplsuqbawlz mentioned, it’s actually a separate Runnable class that interacts with a small bit of synchronized code in the client to own our feeble attempts at humanlike mouse movements.
